H0.text: Sweat glands remove water, salts, and other wastes from the skin.

H1.text: Sex glands remove water, salts, and other wastes from skin.

H2.text: Push glands remove water, salts, and other wastes from skin.

H3.text: Water glands remove water, salts, and other wastes from skin.

A4.text: Sweat glands are used to regulate temperature and remove waste by secreting water, sodium salts, and nitrogenous waste (such as urea) onto the skin surface.

A5.text: Eccrine sweat is composed of 98â€“99% water; it also contains NaCl, fatty acids, lactic acid, citric acid, ascorbic acid, urea, and uric acid.
